title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a timeless dessert that combines a flaky homemade crust with a luscious, sweet pecan filling. Perfectly golden and beautifully textured, this pie is sure to impress at any gathering or cozy afternoon treat.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling mixture over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is golden brown and set.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling set perfectly.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to create a flaky crust; avoid overworking the dough to keep it tender. Watch the pie closely during the last 10 minutes of baking to prevent over-browning. Let the pie cool fully to ensure the filling sets properly for clean slices.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a beautiful blend of buttery crust and a rich, gooey pecan filling that crackles with sweetness and toasted nutty flavor. Its golden top and inviting aroma make it a standout dessert that captures the heart of Southern hospitality.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Classic Southern dessert with authentic flavors
  • Flaky homemade crust paired with a rich pecan filling
  • Perfect for holidays, family gatherings, or special occasions
  • Uses simple pantry staples for an impressive homemade treat
  • Offers a beautiful presentation with glossy pecan halves on top

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, and it instantly became a beloved tradition. The warmth of the pecans combined with the sweet filling always brings back memories of laughter and shared stories around the table.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide a crunchy texture and rich flavor essential to this pie. Choose high-quality pecans for the best taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and depth of the filling, while light corn syrup creates that classic glossy, smooth texture.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs add richness and help bind the filling, while flour stabilizes the texture.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, rolling pin, 9-inch pie plate, and an oven thermometer for precise baking.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and ensure flakiness.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Arrange pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then lower temperature to cook filling until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely on a wire rack to allow filling to firm up for clean slices. Serve at room temperature or slightly warmed with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Chilling the dough is crucial for a flaky crust
  • Avoid opening the oven door frequently during baking to prevent temperature drops
  • The filling should be set and slightly jiggly in the center when done
  • Store leftover pie covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerated for up to 4 days; reheat gently before serving

structured_content.content: This pie has been a centerpiece at many family celebrations, evoking nostalgia and smiles. Sharing it with loved ones makes every bite sweeter and every moment more memorable.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a warm, spiced twist. Toasting the pecans lightly before adding them deepens their flavor and adds extra crunch.

Serve slices with a dollop of freshly whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of sweet dessert wine for a perfect finish. Ideal for holiday dinners, brunches, or afternoon tea.

For a gluten-free version, substitute the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can use coconut oil instead of butter and a flax egg in place of eggs, though texture will vary. Try adding chocolate chips or dried cranberries for a unique flavor profile.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use cold butter and ice water to keep the crust tender and flaky
  • Mix filling ingredients just until combined to avoid overworking
  • Bake first at high heat to set crust, then reduce temperature for even cooking
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a golden, glossy finish
